word:
MR No. 340 - On Women's Role

     It is not right for you to suppose that I am striving to be first, striving for leadership. . . . I want it to be understood that I have no ambition to have the name of leader, or any other name that may be given me, except that of a messenger of God. I claim no other name or position. My life and works speak for themselves.--Letter 320, 1905, p. 4. (To J. H. Kellogg, November 21, 1905.)
